titleStmt.title: O. A. Reynolds to James F. Robinson
CWG8886

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To His Excellency
James F. Robinson
Governor of the Comth of Kentucky --

Your Petitioner, Otho A. Reynolds, would respectfully represent that at the June Term of the Lexington City Court he was tried under a warrant from said Court in the name of the Commonwealth, for committing an assault upon one George Lancaster and upon said trial was fined in the sum of Forty Dollars. That the striking was committed some time in the month of March 1863 in the city of Lexington. That he and said Lancaster had for some time been unfriendly and that on the day specified he and Lancaster met on the streets of Lexington and said Lancaster pressed against him on the street and that your petitioner merely struck him slightly with his open hand.
Your Petitioner would respectfully ask your Excellency to remit said fine thus inflicted except costs & fees & he will ever pray &c.
Otho A. Reynolds says that the foregoing statements are true to the best of his knowledge -- & has made oath to the same before me this 25th June 1863.

Att Jno B Norton C f C C
By Chas F Lowry D C
We, the undersigned recommend the within for the exercise of Executive clemency.

June 25th 1863
W T Scott
Timothy Daly -- Juror --
R. McMichael, Juror.
R J Woodham, Juror

Wm VanBelt Sr
Jno. L. Lillard } Jurors

A. O. Reynolds Pettn to remit fine in Lex. City Court
Lexington City Ct
vs.
A. O. Reynolds
